# customField(evaluationBlock:)

**Type Method**

Creates a field that runs the specified block to determine the force a field applies to each object in its area of effect.

## Declaration

```swift
class func customField(evaluationBlock block: @escaping SCNFieldForceEvaluator) -> SCNPhysicsField
```

## Parameters

- **block**: A block that SceneKit runs for each object in the field’s area of effect. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNFieldForceEvaluator].

## Return Value

A physics field object. To use the field in a scene, attach it to the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/physicsField] property of an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode] object.

## Discussion

For custom physics fields, SceneKit ignores the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/direction], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/strength], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/falloffExponent], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/minimumDistance] properties. Instead, SceneKit calls your block to determine the direction and magnitude of force to apply to each physics body or particle in the field’s area of effect.
